lexUnit.name: foot.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the lower or lowest part of something vertical; the base or bottom.

sentence.text: A thick hedge shielded her from the field which swept down towards the foot of the embankment .
It was a bright day now but the caf√© , tucked in at the foot of the buildings that hemmed in the square , was in the shade .
She pointed to the foot of Georgina 's desk .
And as for the Ark of Moses , this was the sacred chest fashioned at the foot of Mount Sinai to contain the sacred tablets of stone .
When he reached the foot of the ladder , Grant turned and directed the torch light down the length of the tunnel in which he now found himself .
The silver guardian angel at the foot of the cradle .
The route crosses two sites of special scientific interest ( SSSIs ) -- the chalk downland itself , and water meadows at the hill 's foot .
A cloud occludes the mountain 's foot
I stood at the foot of the bed and watched my grandfather go to sleep .
You leave the gas bottle on the floor at the foot of the bed and walk quickly away along the shorter length of corridor and step through the emergency exit out into the loud darkness of the night .
He leaves the window and walks round the foot of the bed .
A bulging section provides the crux and allows access to rock of a far more amendable angle in the form of a large slab ‚Äî hidden from the foot of the cliff .

Not until that is done will the sea be able to recommence its erosive activities at the foot of the cliff .
Scores of curious seals , disturbed in their play at the foot of the cliffs , swum out to investigate .
At the foot of the hill , just ahead of the expanding forest as the adventurers reach him , the Ethereal Champion of Tzeentch appears ( see Profiles ) .
On top of everything else , my line had to take over the Cross at the foot of the hill .
The river Avon ran past the foot of the hill on which the castle was situated .
At the foot of the mountain , it was received by a piece of arrable ground , on which its violence first broke .
Situated at the foot of a mountain and bordered by a trout stream , this is an easy place to feel completely relaxed in .
Then there was nothing again but the darkness ; the darkness that he knew waited for him at the foot of the mountain .
She moved to the foot of the stairs .
The front door and the vestibule door had been blown off and the heavy mahogany coat stand lay across the foot of the stairs .
I turned from the foot of the stairs and walked quickly down the hall and pushed the kitchen door wide open .
